history.proof: intros Q a p Hcanonical Hred1 r s Hred2 Hred3 r1 s1 Hreduce1 Hreduce2. shelve.

ctx: intros Q a p Hcanonical Hred1 r s Hred2 Hred3 r1 s1 Hreduce1 Hreduce2.
exceptions.tactic: apply (eqP A eqA n r1 s1).
exceptions.exn: In environment A : Type A0, A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA, multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n -> Prop ltM_dec : forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b} os : OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n) Q : list (poly A0 eqA ltM) a : Term A n p : list (Term A n) Hcanonical : canonical A0 eqA ltM (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) Hred1 : forall q : list (Term A n), canonical A0 eqA ltM q -> ltP (A:=A) ltM q (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) -> ReduStarConfluent Q q r, s : list (Term A n) Hred2 : reduce A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a r) Hred3 : reduce A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a s) r1, s1 : list (Term A n) Hreduce1 : reducestar A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a r) r1 Hreduce2 : reducestar A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a s) s1 Unable to unify "Prop" with "eqP A eqA n r1 s1".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
A1: A
A0: A
eqA: A -> A -> Prop
plusA: A -> A -> A
invA: A -> A
multA: A -> A -> A
minusA: A -> A -> A
divA: A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A
cs: CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA
eqA_dec: forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}
n: nat
ltM: mon n -> mon n -> Prop
ltM_dec: forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}
os: OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n)

Goal:
forall (Q : list (poly A0 eqA ltM)) (a : Term A n) (p : list (Term A n)), canonical A0 eqA ltM (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) -> (forall q : list (Term A n), canonical A0 eqA ltM q -> ltP (A:=A) ltM q (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) -> ReduStarConfluent Q q) -> forall r s : list (Term A n), reduce A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a r) -> reduce A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a s) -> forall r1 s1 : list (Term A n), reducestar A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a r) r1 -> reducestar A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a s) s1 -> eqP A eqA n r1 s1
